korean: 폭염 주의보가 발령돼서 낮 시간대는 외출을 자제했다.
뉴스에서 온열 질환 주의하라는 말이 계속 나왔어.
에어컨을 하루 종일 틀어놔서 전기세가 걱정된다.
그래도 안 틀면 죽을 것 같아서 어쩔 수 없지.
시원한 물 계속 마시면서 하루 종일 소파에 누워있었어.
저녁에 잠깐 편의점 갔다 왔는데 땀이 쏟아졌다.
밤이 돼도 더워서 선풍기 틀고 잤어.
이렇게 더운 여름은 처음인 것 같다.
뉴스에서 내일도 폭염이래. 진짜 가을 언제 오냐.
english: A heatwave advisory was issued, so I refrained from going out during the day.
I checked the weather app around 2 PM and the feels-like temperature was 38 degrees.
The news kept warning to be careful of heat-related illnesses.
I'm worried about the electricity bill from running the AC all day.
But honestly, if I don't run it, I feel like I'm gonna die, so what can I do?
I ate two ice creams and I'm still hot.
I spent the whole day on the couch, you know, drinking cold water constantly.
I went to the convenience store for a bit in the evening and sweat was just pouring down.
Even at night it was hot, so I slept with the fan on.
I think this is the hottest summer I've ever experienced.
The news said it's gonna be another heatwave tomorrow. Like, seriously, when is fall coming?
I really wish cooler weather would come soon.
